datasets.name: cb4b3869
queryLines:
SELECT
  calendar_date,
  YEAR(calendar_date) AS year,
  MONTH(calendar_date) AS month,
  DAY(calendar_date) AS day,
  WEEKOFYEAR(calendar_date) AS week_of_year,
  DAYOFWEEK(calendar_date) AS day_of_week, -- Sunday = 1, Monday = 2, ..., Saturday = 7
  DATE_FORMAT(calendar_date, 'EEEE') AS day_name, -- Full day name (e.g., Monday)
  DATE_FORMAT(calendar_date, 'MMMM') AS month_name, -- Full month name (e.g., January)
  QUARTER(calendar_date) AS quarter,
  CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(calendar_date) IN (1, 7) THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END AS is_weekend,
  LAST_DAY(calendar_date) AS last_day_of_month
FROM
  EXPLODE(
    SEQUENCE(DATE '2019-10-01', DATE '2020-04-30', INTERVAL 1 DAY)
  ) AS t(calendar_date)
ORDER BY
  calendar_date;

datasets.name: c8f5401a
queryLines:
WITH dimmed AS (
  -- 1) Select all data and create the dynamic dimension column
  SELECT
    date,
    -- Handle NULL, empty, or whitespace-only categories/brands for robust grouping
    CASE :series
      WHEN 'category'       THEN COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(category), ''), 'Uncategorized')
      WHEN 'brand'          THEN COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(brand), ''), 'Unknown Brand')
      WHEN 'category-brand' THEN concat(COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(category), ''), 'Uncategorized'),' - ',COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(brand), ''), 'Unknown Brand'))
      -- NEW: Add product_id as a dimension. Assuming product_id is never NULL or empty.
      WHEN 'product_id'     THEN CAST(product_id AS STRING)
    END AS dim,
    checkouts,
    views,
    add_to_cart,
    revenue,
    orders
  FROM techwards.ecom_gold.performance_metrics -- No more WHERE clause
),

-- 2) rank dims by total checkouts, keep only top N
ranked AS (
  SELECT
    dim,
    SUM(checkouts)            AS total_checkouts,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
      ORDER BY SUM(checkouts) DESC
    ) AS rn
  FROM dimmed
  GROUP BY dim
),

top_dims AS (
  SELECT dim
  FROM ranked
  WHERE rn <= CAST(:top_n AS INT)
),

-- 3) apply time‐grain bucket and filter to top dims
periodized AS (
  SELECT
    -- true date for sorting
    CASE :period
      WHEN 'daily'   THEN date_trunc('day',   date)
      WHEN 'weekly'  THEN date_trunc('week',  date)
      WHEN 'monthly' THEN date_trunc('month', date)
    END AS period_order,

    -- label shown on X‐axis
    CASE :period
      WHEN 'daily'   THEN date_format(date,   'yyyy-MM-dd')
      WHEN 'weekly'  THEN CAST(weekofyear(date) AS STRING)
      WHEN 'monthly' THEN date_format(date,   'MMM')
    END AS period_label,
    date,
    dim,
    checkouts,
    views,
    add_to_cart,
    revenue,
    orders
  FROM dimmed
  WHERE dim IN (SELECT dim FROM top_dims)
)

-- 4) final aggregation & ordering
SELECT
  date,
  period_label,
  dim                             AS dimension,
  SUM(checkouts)                  AS total_checkouts,
  SUM(views)                      AS total_views,
  SUM(add_to_cart)                AS total_add_to_cart,
  SUM(revenue)                    AS total_revenue,
  SUM(orders)                     AS total_orders
  -- ... (your other calculated metrics like AOV, conversion rates, etc.)
FROM periodized
GROUP BY period_order, period_label, dim, date
ORDER BY period_order, total_checkouts DESC;

datasets.name: 7e69face
queryLines:
WITH dimmed AS (
  -- 1) Select all data and create the dynamic dimension column
  SELECT
    date,
    -- Handle NULL, empty, or whitespace-only categories/brands for robust grouping
    CASE :series
      WHEN 'category'       THEN COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(category), ''), 'Uncategorized')
      WHEN 'brand'          THEN COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(brand), ''), 'Unknown Brand')
      WHEN 'category-brand' THEN concat(COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(category), ''), 'Uncategorized'),' - ',COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(brand), ''), 'Unknown Brand'))
      -- NEW: Add product_id as a dimension. Assuming product_id is never NULL or empty.
      WHEN 'product_id'     THEN CAST(product_id AS STRING)
    END AS dim,
    checkouts,
    views,
    add_to_cart,
    revenue,
    orders
  FROM techwards.ecom_gold.performance_metrics
),

-- 2) apply time-grain bucket (fixed to daily)
periodized AS (
  SELECT
    -- true date for sorting and display
    date_trunc('day', date) AS period_order,
    date_format(date, 'yyyy-MM-dd') AS period_label, -- Format date as yyyy-MM-dd [1, 7]
    dim,
    checkouts,
    views,
    add_to_cart,
    revenue,
    orders
  FROM dimmed
)

-- 3) final aggregation & ordering
SELECT
  cast(period_label as date) AS date, -- Renamed for clarity as per your request
  dim AS dimension,
  SUM(views) AS total_views,
  SUM(checkouts) AS total_checkouts,
  SUM(add_to_cart) AS total_add_to_cart,
  SUM(revenue) AS total_revenue,
  SUM(orders) AS total_orders
FROM periodized
GROUP BY period_order, period_label, dim
ORDER BY period_order, total_checkouts DESC;

datasets.name: edead479
queryLines:
SELECT
  *,
  YEAR(cohort_month) AS year,
  DATE_FORMAT(cohort_month, 'MMM') AS Month,
  DATE_FORMAT(cohort_month, 'MMM yyyy') AS Month_year
FROM
  ecom_gold.customer_cohort_analysis;

datasets.name: bcb2c9bf
queryLines:
WITH base_data AS (
  SELECT
    purchase_date,
    user_id,
    purchase_number
  FROM
    ecom_gold.user_purchase_history
  -- Optional: Add a date range filter for performance
  -- WHERE purchase_date BETWEEN :date_range.start AND :date_range.end
)
-- Final aggregation to count new, repeat, and loyal customers
SELECT
  purchase_date,
  -- New Customers: Users whose 1st purchase occurred in this period
  COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN purchase_number = 1 THEN user_id ELSE NULL END) AS new_customers,
  -- Repeat Customers: Users whose 2nd purchase occurred in this period
  COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN purchase_number = 2 THEN user_id ELSE NULL END) AS repeat_customers,
  -- Loyal Customers: Users whose 3rd or more purchase occurred in this period
  COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN purchase_number > 2 THEN user_id ELSE NULL END) AS loyal_customers,
  YEAR(purchase_date) AS year,
  DATE_FORMAT(purchase_date, 'MMM') AS Month,
  DATE_FORMAT(purchase_date, 'MMM yyyy') AS Month_year
FROM
  base_data
GROUP BY
  purchase_date
ORDER BY
  purchase_date;

datasets.name: 3bb97ca4
queryLines:
SELECT
  item_a_value AS row_item,
  item_b_value AS column_item,
  -- Calculate Confidence (A -> B)
  CAST(SUM(count_a_and_b) AS DOUBLE) / SUM(count_a) AS confidence_a_to_b
FROM
  ecom_gold.market_basket_analysis_counts
WHERE
  item_type = :mba_item_type -- Dashboard parameter for 'product_id', 'category', or 'brand'
GROUP BY
  item_a_value,
  item_b_value
ORDER BY
  item_a_value,
  item_b_value;

datasets.name: 59712f98
queryLines:
WITH
  confidence_calculations AS (
    -- First, calculate the confidence for all pairs of the selected item type
    SELECT
      item_a_value,
      item_b_value,
      -- Calculate Confidence (A -> B) and handle potential division by zero
      CAST(SUM(count_a_and_b) AS DOUBLE) / NULLIF(SUM(count_a), 0) AS confidence_a_to_b
    FROM
      ecom_gold.market_basket_analysis_counts
    WHERE
      -- This is the dashboard parameter for 'category', 'brand', or 'product_id'
      item_type = :mba_item_type
      -- Exclude self-comparisons (e.g., category A -> category A)
      AND item_a_value != item_b_value
    GROUP BY
      item_a_value,
      item_b_value
  ),
  ranked_confidence AS (
    -- Next, rank the calculated confidences to find the top performers
    SELECT
      item_a_value,
      item_b_value,
      confidence_a_to_b,
      -- Use ROW_NUMBER() to assign a unique rank to each row, ignoring ties.
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY confidence_a_to_b DESC) as row_num
    FROM
      confidence_calculations
    -- Filter out any pairs where confidence could not be calculated
    WHERE confidence_a_to_b IS NOT NULL
  )
-- Finally, format the output as requested and select only the top 10
SELECT
  -- This CONCAT function creates the 'dimension' column you wanted
  CONCAT(item_a_value, ' -> ', item_b_value) AS dimension,
  confidence_a_to_b
FROM
  ranked_confidence
WHERE
  row_num <= 10 -- This filter will now work perfectly for all dimensions
ORDER BY
  confidence_a_to_b DESC;
